summary: The Earthquake Resilience Act (H.R. 2568) mandates a national risk assessment within two years of its enactment. This assessment, conducted by several federal agencies in collaboration with stakeholders, will identify progress and gaps in community earthquake resilience. The bill also amends the Earthquake Hazards Reduction Act of 1977, focusing on improved post-earthquake recovery, including standards for lifeline infrastructure, and expanding data sources for seismic monitoring.
